criteria: Ability to locate first aid resources in school, community, and on the Internet.
Ability to assess the validity of first aid resources.
Demonstrates understanding of first aid information and training relevance.
descriptions: Student is unable to locate any first aid resources.
Student can locate one type of first aid resource with significant guidance.
Student can locate two types of first aid resources with some guidance.
Student can locate three types of first aid resources with minimal guidance.
Student can independently locate multiple first aid resources in various locations.
Student independently and efficiently locates a comprehensive range of first aid resources in diverse settings.
Student does not attempt to assess the validity of any resources.
Student attempts to assess validity but uses inappropriate or ineffective methods.
Student identifies one criterion for assessing validity with some prompting.
Student identifies and applies basic criteria for assessing validity (e.g., source, date) to some resources.
Student critically assesses the validity of multiple resources using established criteria.
Student thoroughly and accurately assesses the validity of resources, explaining their reasoning and potential biases.
Student shows no understanding of the relevance of first aid information or training.
Student vaguely identifies a single benefit of first aid training.
Student identifies a few reasons why first aid knowledge is important.
Student explains the general importance of first aid and its applications.
Student explains why first aid is important in specific scenarios.
Student articulates the benefits of first aid and personal preparedness with detailed justifications.
